title: Rotational Tunning Mechanisms of Crystalline Thermal Conductivity Revealed by Electron Microscopy
content: Phonons, lattice vibrations in crystals, carry heat and can be scattered by defects and inhomogeneities. Conventionally, phonon transport is tuned through the engineering of defects, interfaces, and nanostructures [1]. However, these modifications also affect other desirable properties of materials and degrade their performance. Thus, tuning phonon transport of materials at the nanoscale remains a crucial issue for multifunctional materials and devices [2, 3]. A precise and predictable method for addressing the needs of technological innovation in thermal transport is highly desirable.
